poem:
### Concession

At the round table,  
where words spill,  
an echo of power  
calls for greatness.  
A dance of intent,  
echoes of strategy,  
lines drawn on maps—  
no soil beneath our feet.  

In hushed treaties,  
we broker winds,  
whispers past borders—  
all shall remain still.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We must make Nato great again,’ says Pete Hegseth at Nato – Europe live 4.07pm GMT Hegseth rejects suggestions of early concessions to Putin Asked about the criticism of Trump’s approach as making concessions to Putin, Hegseth responds: The arguments that have been made that somehow coming to the table right now is making concessions to Vladimir Putin outright, that the president of the United States shouldn’t otherwise make … I just reject that at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
